_header: When that Bachus the mighty lord
_description: Colyn Blowbols Testament — 405 lines, generally in couplets

BodRawC86.First Lines:
Whan that Bachus the myghti lordeAnd sy no eke both by one
                    accorde…
BodRawC86.Last Lines:
…To draw the bake fer out of them sightLest thow be had in
                    repreef and dispite
BodRawC86.Attributed Title:
Here foloweth Colyn blowbols Testament (scribe, f. 106v); Here
                    endyth Colyn Blobollys Testament (scribe, f. 113)
BodRawC86.Editions:
Halliwell-Phillipps,  James Orchard. 
             Nugae Poeticae: Select Pieces of Old English Popular Poetry,
                Illustrating the Manners and Arts of the Fifteenth Century.
         London: J. R. Smith, 1844: 1-12.
Hazlitt,  William Carew. 
             Remains of the Early Popular Poetry of England.
         London: J. R. Smith, 1864-6: 1.92-109.
